component.name: FC30
component.summary: Firmware for the 8Bitdo FC30 Game Controller

description.p: Updating the firmware on your FC30 device improves performance and adds new features.

screenshot.caption: Unplug the controller, hold down L+R+START for 3 seconds until both LEDs are flashing then reconnect the controller.
Unplug the controller, hold down L+R+START for 3 seconds until both LEDs are flashing then reconnect the controller.

description.p: Fixed input lag problem when used with other controllers.
Support remapping the buttons by the RemapTools on Gamepad Mode.

component.name: FC30 Joystick
component.summary: Firmware for the 8Bitdo FC30 Joystick Game Controller

description.p: Updating the firmware on your FC30 Joystick device improves performance and adds new features.
Add support for Joystick Mode to OS X.

description.p: This stable release fixes the following issues:

ul.li: Enhance the stability of the Bluetooth automatic connection

component.name: H05 Wireless Headband
component.summary: Firmware for the AIAIAI H05 Wireless Headband

description.p: Updating the firmware on your H05 improves performance and adds new features.
The following bugs have been fixed:

ul.li: Removed "link loss" sound when getting out of range of connected device
Re-enabled power off sound
Resolve issues with button controls on macOS, iOS and Android
Set auto power off to 10 minutes
Fix a responsiveness issue when disconnecting from an AptX HD connection

component.name: Embedded Box PC 5000 System Update
component.summary: Firmware for the Dell Embedded Box PC 5000

description.p: Updating the system firmware improves performance.
Fixes:

ul.li: Fixed a potential security issue with Bootguard code integrity chaining enforcement.
SystemDefense with wireless parameter will cause ME failure

description.p: Enhancements:

ul.li: Updated Intel processor microcode.
Updated Intel ME Firmware to address security advisory CVE-2017-5689 / INTEL-SA-00075.
System stability enhancements
To prevent user update ME Firmware to blacklist 11.6 ME firmware
Updated Absolute BIOS Persistence module.
Update TPM clear behavior.
Fixed abnormal shutdown when using Dell Command Configure

component.name: ColorHug
component.summary: Firmware for the Hughski ColorHug Colorimeter

description.p: Updating the firmware on your ColorHug device improves performance and adds new features.
This release fixes prevents the firmware returning an error when the remote SHA1 hash was never sent.
This release fixes the firmware package to work with new versions of fwupd.
This release adds support for verifying the firmware contents using fwupd.

component.name: ColorHug2
component.summary: Firmware for the Hughski ColorHug2 Colorimeter

description.p: Updating the firmware on your ColorHug2 device improves performance and adds new features.
This release fixes prevents the firmware returning an error when the remote SHA1 hash was never sent.
This stable release fixes the following problems:

ul.li: Fix the swapped LEDs on the second half of batch 16
Fix the firmware upgrade process using new versions of fwupd

description.p: This stable release fixes the following problems:

ul.li: Fix the swapped LEDs on batch 16
Make the self test more sensitive to detect floating pins

component.name: ColorHugALS
component.summary: Firmware for the Hughski ColorHug Ambient Light Sensor

description.p: Updating the firmware on your ColorHugALS device improves performance and adds new features.
Remove the invalid .inf file from the release tarball. No code or behaviour changes.
We now expose a standard HID ALS sensor, which means the device works with Linux, OS X and Windows8+ without installing a driver.
Many thanks to Benjamin Tissoires for the initial firmware, testing and client code examples.
This stable release fixes the following bugs:

ul.li: Fix the return code from GetHardwareVersion
Scale the output of TakeReadingRaw by the datasheet values

description.p: The K780 is a keyboard that allows switching among three paired hosts.
This firmware update is required to render the K780 fully compatible with Unifying receivers with firmwares RQR12.xx where (xx >= 08) and RQR24.xx where (xx >= 06).

component.name: Logitech Unifying Receiver
component.summary: Firmware for the Logitech Unifying receiver

description.p: A Unifying receiver allows you to connect multiple compatible keyboards and mice to a laptop or desktop computer with a single USB receiver. Updating the firmware on your Unifying receiver improves performance, adds new features and fixes security issues.

This release addresses an unencrypted keystroke injection issue known as Bastille security issue #11. The vulnerability is complex to replicate and would require a hacker to be physically close to a target.

component.name: Logitech Unifying Receiver
component.summary: Firmware for the Logitech Unifying receiver

description.p: A Unifying receiver allows you to connect multiple compatible keyboards and mice to a laptop or desktop computer with a single USB receiver. Updating the firmware on your Unifying receiver improves performance, adds new features and fixes security issues.

This release addresses an unencrypted keystroke injection issue known as Bastille security issue #11. The vulnerability is complex to replicate and would require a hacker to be physically close to a target.
